192513.name: Cuan Bestia Soy
192513.description:
From the box (Translated):
"To play Cuan Bestia Soy no special skills are needed , only names of trees, of countries, of artists, of things in a library , etc. With some of these issues and an initial letter each round is long... but hurry up! because only the fastest players can upgrade. The others will go down.
Is a game for fun ... so much fun and a good opportunity to demostrate intelligence , wit, memory and speed. "

In each turn, a player throws the dice and moves the pawn on some of the letters. Another player will be in charge of drawing a card which indicates the subject (eg characters of history, capital cities, islands or mountains). Once listed, write a word or phrase that meets these conditions and put his hand on the mark. The first will come to the throne and the last, will go down a step.

The goal is to reach the top of the board: the Throne or make any of the rivals down everything and get crowned Beast.

From the box (Spanish):
"Para jugar 'Cuan Bestia Soy' no hacen falta conocimientos especiales, sólo nombres de árboles, de países, de artistas, de cosas que hay en una librería, etc. Con algunos de estos temas y una letra inicial se larga cada ronda... pero ¡apúrense! ya que solo los más rápidos podrán ascender de categoría.
Los demás se van para abajo.
Es un juego para divertirse... para divertirse mucho y una buena oportunidad de demostrar inteligencia, ingenio, memoria y rapidez."

En cada turno, un jugador arroja el dado y mueve el peón sobre alguna de las letras. Otro se encargará de sacar una carta donde indique el tema (por ejemplo: Personajes de la historia, Capitales de Países, Islas o Montañas). Una vez indicados, se debe escribir una palabra o frase que cumpla estas condiciones y colocar la mano sobre la marca. Los primeros se acercarán al trono y los últimos bajarán un escalón.

El objetivo del juego es llegar a la cima del tablero: el Trono o lograr que alguno de los rivales llegue abajo de todo coronándose Bestia.

192514.description:
User summary (Translated):
This expansion is for players over 18 years old.
Includes 69 cards that are mixed in the common deck and others that are divided into 4 decks (Picantor (Spiced Up) 1, 2, 3 and 4).
Whenever you lose you can draw a card from the special decks, and if you fulfill the challenge, you are back to the game. It also comes with a special die because you have to use when the cards do so.

User summary (Spanish):
Esta expansión es para mayores de 18 años.
Incluye 69 cartas que se mezclan en el mazo común y otras que se dividen en 4 mazos (Picantor 1, 2, 3 y 4).
Siempre que perdés podes robar una carta de los mazos especiales y si cumplís la consigna, seguís en juego. Además trae un dado especial que tenés que usar cuando las cartas así lo indiquen.
192514.name: No lo testeamos ni un Poco: Picante
boardgameexpansion: We Didn't Playtest This At All
boardgamefamily: We Didn't Playtest This At All

192516.description: This is a 10 card pack of historical items and relics what were made available in the deluxe edition of Scoundrel Society. These cards add more complexity, variety, and historical element to each game.
192516.name: Scoundrel Society: Historical Loot

192518.name: Kalma
192518.description:
User summary:

Characters have a name, an aged-based limitation, a defined "last act" to accomplish, and three Attributes (Tired, Frail, and Lonely). Action resolution uses a simple mechanism based on d6 rolls.

192519.name: After Days: Survival is Everything!
boardgamepublisher: Dice Made Me Do It! LLC
192519.description:
In After Days: Survival is Everything! each player takes the role of a pair of Post-Apocalyptic survivors working cooperatively with other players to provide for the group and deal with the threats arrayed against them. Each turn players send one of their two survivors, each has a specific ability, into harm's way to gather supplies by pulling three random dice and rolling them. Each dice has four possible resource outcomes: food, protection, shelter, and scrap which can be converted and used by certain Survivors.

Survivors must then nullify the threats arrayed against them such as devastating weather breakouts which cause a wound for each resource not met. Roving bands of marauders that continue to come back on subsequent turns if not dealt with swiftly. Finally, the risen dead refuse to go down until all of the dead have their resources met.

To nullify threats Survivors must provide the resources required on each threat card either using rolled dice or Survivor card abilities. Deal with all the threats and take no wounds. Fail to deal with a threat and it injures one of your Survivors, which can cost you the game. Survive six turns with at least one Survivor still alive and you win the game!

Each version of the game supports up to four players so feel free to combine two games to have up to eight players fight for their survival!

192520.name: House of Masks (2008)
192520.description:
User summary:

House of Masks uses a very atypical mechanic of having six players (exactly) control three characters in a "tag-team style". Each character has two primary Aspects ("real world" and "spirit world") though one is active at a time. Narrative conflict is resolved by proposing various outcomes and then selecting form among them.

User summary:

The game was published as an ASCII text file only.

192521.name: Devil Tree Station: Skin That Smokewagon!
boardgamepublisher: Dice Made Me Do It! LLC
192521.description:
In Devil Tree Station: Skin That Smokewagon! each player takes the role of either a Wanted gang outlaw or justice fueled Posse member in a lead filled shootout in the dirt covered streets of the Wild West town of Devil Tree Station. Out think your adversaries through decisive actions and straight shooting.

Each player selects a character card to portray them, either a Posse Member or Wanted Outlaw and teams emerge The Posse and the Wanted Outlaws. Each team has a four card action deck from which each player on the team selects an action to play each turn. Also of interest is each character has a action card that if played by them allows them to reroll any or all of their action dice once. This is their "tell" as the other side sees this as well. Will you follow you tell and risk the other team playing an opposing card or do you avoid it and surprise them but forfeit the chance to reroll. If the other team plays the correct corresponding action they steal half of your action dice, so the risk and rewards are very real.

Each player plays an Action Card face down and places some or all of their dice on the action Card becoming their Action Dice...the remainder goes on the Character Card. Play then proceeds from fewest Action Dice to most...there's the fast and the dead.

The Active Player flips over their Action Card while designating a target on the other team who flips over their card. If the Active Players Action Card counteracts the Targets, the Acting player immediately steals half the Target's Action Dice and places them on their Character card.

Next the Active player rolls their Action Dice looking for icons that match their Action Card. For example, if they played the Cover Action they look for Cover icons on the dice. Each rolled die that matches the Action card allows the Active Player to move one of the Target's Action Dice to the Active Players Character card. Then the next lowest number of Action Dice goes and so on...Last Team of Player with dice remaining wins!

The real beauty of this game is that it can be played as either an every player for themselves free-for-all or as a team based battle fighting for dominance of the town. Each version of the game supports up to four players, but feel free to combine two games to have up to eight players fight for supremacy!

192522.name: Letter of Patent
192522.description:
User summary:

Letter of Patent utilizes an exceptional and unique method of character generation. Each character establishes a genealogy of fourteen ancestors. Every ancestor has a Title; the Title contributes Attribute modifiers (bonuses and penalties) to the character. The character's Attributes are thus numerically determined by their ancestry. The six Attributes are Melee, Joust, Shield, Romance, Honor, and Wealth.

The primary conflict of the game centers around a medieval tournament with jousting and social interaction.

192523.name: Pantheon Ascension: Even Mythical Family Trees Need Pruning
boardgamepublisher: Dice Made Me Do It! LLC
192523.description:
In Pantheon Ascension: Even Mythical Family Trees Need Pruning each player takes the role of a minor Norse deity backstabbing their way to the top of the family tree by stealing temples, brainwashing followers, and robbing their kin of prestige.

Players start with three random dice and one Major Deity card. Each turn they choose two of four possible actions in an attempt to get sets of four temples, prestige, or followers, while avoiding three mockery icons. The four possible actions are: Reroll any or all dice, add a random dice to dice pool, play Deity card, and Duel another player. Players cannot perform any action twice!

Getting and rolling dice is self explanatory, while playing a God card involves picking a target for the effect on the card, playing it and resolving the effect, and drawing a replacement card. Some cards have good effects while others have detrimental ones, but the only way to replace a God card is to play it.

Dueling involves both players rolling all of their dice, which is a nice way to ruin someones plans if they're showing three of a kind. The winner is the player with the most non-mockery icons showing and they get 1/2 of all the dice rounded up, keeping all the rolled faces, while the loser gets the remainder. This is a great way to get more dice if you only have a few and Duel someone with many, and if you win you can even grab a set of scoring dice from those rolled.

If at any time your dice show three or more mockery icons, immediately throw away all of your dice, draw three new dice, roll them, and end your turn. This includes Duels: When one or more players shows at least three Mockery icons during a duel, the duel is immediately canceled, each player retains their dice, and the player(s) showing 3+ mockery need to follow the steps at the beginning of this paragraph.

Scoring sets of dice occurs automatically at the end of a players turn and awards a single victory token. Get three victory tokens and your Ascend to Major God status and win!

Each version of the game supports up to four players so feel free to combine two games to have up to eight players fight for supremacy!

boardgamepublisher: Dice Made Me Do It! LLC
192524.description:
Shadow Wars: The Information Arms Race is an adversarial game of backstabbing, assassination, and asset manipulation set in 1980s, the height the Cold War. The overall goal is simple, be the first to gather three pieces of intelligence and dominate the Shadow War. To accomplish this task, players secretly target other players/nations and roll dice, which represent agents in an attempt to gather intelligence.

Players start the game with 1 Asset Die, 1 Ghost Die, and 1 Attack Die. All of these dice are identical except that they have one face that shows 2 x their specific type (i.e. Ghost die has a face with 2 x Ghost icons). They also start with one piece of Intel. The Intel goes on their Home nation card along with all dice.

Each turn players put some or all of their dice on a hidden target card of their choice. They then roll some or all of their Target card dice along with 0-5 World dice, which differ from the other dice by not having a double icon face and and extra blown cover icon...Expendable agents are very risky, but allow players with few dice to continue to play and be competitive. The goal is to get three icons of the same type, Assets, Ghosts, or Attacks, without getting three blown cover which forces players to reveal their target.

When players get three of a kind, they reveal their Target nation card, who then gets to defend. If the defense is unsuccessful, players steal an Intel token from the victim along with inflicting one other insult: 3 Ghost icons = No defense allowed; 3 Asset icons = Steal 1 die; 3 Attack icons = Kill one dice.

The winner is the first player with three Intel tokens. How will you deal with the myriad of threats arrayed against you and win the information war…the choice is yours!
192524.name: Shadow Wars: The Information Arms Race

192525.name: Art of China
192525.description:
User Summary

Loom is a graphical adventure game. Story is about Thomas who has lost his brother Peter in a fight with a gang leader. The aim is to take revenge for the death of the brother and to rescue the town for the terror of the gang. The game uses a point and click system, and the player can choose between the following commands: Take, Give, Read, Talk, Fight, Use, Pull, Open, On, Off, Walk, and Buy.

192526.name: Silent Archaea
192526.description:
User summary:

Characters are built around Attributes that have a die type assigned (D6, D8, D10, D12) - the best performing Attribute has the highest die type. Actions are resolved by using the die associated with the appropriate Attribute. A natural "1" is a failure and the highest result possible on a die causes it to "explode" into a second, and subsequent, additive roll.

192527.name: Green and Grubby: Goblin Archetypes
192527.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mean Green Killing Machines!

Everyone’s favorite wacky, zany, loveable little villains, goblins are practically the mascots of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, and have been since the beginning. Even before Paizo’s whimsical new take on the small, green menaces, they’ve been a staple of the fantasy genre since Tolkien. But as much as players may love goblins and secretly root for them even as they cut them down, and even though there’s a handful of archetypes, feats, and abilities specifically for goblin PCs, the fact of the matter is that goblins just aren’t a common PC race.

This book aims to give players who want the fact that their character is a goblin to be more mechanically relevant a way to make that happen, while also providing support for goblin characters of a variety of classes that don’t typically make much mechanical sense for goblins. Included are the goblin rider, a cavalier archetype that grants a goblin dog or wolf as a mount, and which allows mount and rider to fight with deadly unity, the goblin horde battler, a fighter archetype that excels in attacking with overwhelming numbers, the goblin skitterknife, a rogue archetype focused on hit and run tactics, skittering across the battlefield to strike a foe, and then scrambling back into hiding before a counterattack can be mounted, the goblin battle shaman, a warpriest archetype devoted to attacking with vicious and self-sacrificing zeal, and the goblin wizard, a wizard archetype able to provide support for an entire horde of goblins, and creating great big magical explosions.

192528.name: Demons Too
192528.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Depths of Demonic Depravity!

Mythic Monsters: Demons Too brings you an awesome array of abyssal adversaries ready to bring pain, torment, destruction, and woe upon the world and your heroes. These dastardly demons range from CR 3 to 23, including some of the lowliest of demonkind, the disguisting dretch and the half-breed cambion, as well as the savage footsoldiers of the Abyssal armies, the spiteful schir with their hewing halberds and the goat-horned brimoraks with their fiery hooves and burning blades. Truly hideous horrors lurk in the foul places of the Abyss, from the filthy and pestilential gibrileth to the foul and bestial kithangian, or even the lowly and loathsome abrikandilu who seek nothing but the wrecking of all things beauteous and fair. The seductively sinister coloxus conceals its insidiously insectile nature beneath a cloak of possession, while the deadly derakni revels in the company of the vilest vermin of the nether pits. The mightiest fiends are agents of death as often for their own kind as for others, as the prowling shemhazian preys upon all things weaker than itself while the subtle seraptis cultivates despair like a crop of death, leaving suicide and hopelessness in its wake, as does the warmongering gallu, lord of bloody battle. As if a dozen existing monsters were not enough, the brand-new skrekalga brings the spirit of absolute obsession and corruption to all it encounters. Add to that a delightfully disturbing piece of demonic fiction by Todd Stewart and you'll be ready to unleash truly exquisite evil upon your heroes.

192529.name: Moebius MacGuffins #1: The Gift
192529.description:
From publisher blurb:

MacGuffins are those items or bits of story that serve to trigger different parts of the plot into action. What would The Maltese Falcon be without that classic figurine of a black bird? Or Raiders of the Lost Ark be without the Ark of the Covenant? What would The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings be without the One Ring?

Though they’re used all the time in films, television, and books, we sometimes use them in our roleplaying game campaigns as well. This series of products aims to provide some ideas on how to randomly generate plot ideas based around simple objects so our players and PCs can sink their teeth into them.

The idea for Moebius MacGuffins: The Gift sprung from a topic explored in the RPG Blog Carnival hosted by the World Builder Blog in December 2015 (Homebrew Holiday Gifts) and rapidly took on a life of its own. This product collects the articles I wrote on the topic and expands on them, including ideas for:

Potential Adventure Seeds
Generating Simple Gift Ideas to Explore
Sending "Special" Gifts from Enemies of the PCs
and "What's in the Box?"




You get some random tables to help generate ideas as well as some ideas to ponder.

As with most Moebius Adventures products, the MacGuffins series will be system- and genre-neutral, offering ideas for multiple genres including fantasy, the Wild West, science fiction, and even modern worlds.

192530.name: Magic Potions
192530.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product features 25 magic potions for use with 5th edition rules.

192531.name: Normality
192531.description:
Publisher blurb:

The best way to use the book is to consider it as a) a product of the setting it attempts to describe, warped by the twisted nature of the world that produced it or b) the way an actor considers a mask – looking for the shards of meaning that will tie the whole thing together. Certainly, read it all (at least twice) before you dismiss it as mere rambling. Take the introduction seriously. We did.

User summary:

Normality always provokes a very strong reaction when it first is encountered. Comments range from rejecting it as incomprehensible to praising is as sublime genius. In any case, the core rulebook is very difficult to approach.

192532.name: Normality: A Guide for Prospective GMs
192532.description:
From the introduction:

Normality is a new kind of roleplaying. At its best, it has allowed a near-telepathic level of communication between players - to the point where group goals were decided and furthered by the whole group without recourse to discussion. As the text itself can be intimidating to a GM unversed in the multiple layers of meaning contained in it, this guide presents a couple of ways to operate the game.

User summary:

The Normality core rulebook often is considered impenetrable by gamers. This Guide for Prospective GMs presents a very slightly easier point of entry to the game.

192533.name: Fat Goblin Travel Guide to Hell
192533.description:
From publisher blurb:

Step into a world that no one truly wishes to visit. A world of hell, damnation, redemption, and absolution.

Welcome to Hell.

Come along with our intrepid guide as he explores the myriad layers of Hell in all of its glory. Written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, this guide not only visits, but delves deep into the history, legends, and horrors that is the darkest and most deadliest of realms.

The Pits - Check out the worlds within worlds of Hell and visit Cocior, Belocor, Neir and other hellish realms.
Hierarchy of the Pit - Find out who the true rulers of Hell are and what motivates the likes of Baalzebul, Belphegor, the lovely and deadly Malfia and many more!
Tools of Hell - The crunch of the book! Learn about the various ways to arm yourself in Hell with new feats, magical items and spells to rock even the strongest of Archdukes.
Classes of Hell - Thirteen hellish archetypes await you including the Contractor (Wizard), Tongue of Sin (Bard), Nemesis (Inquisitor) and the unique Prestige Class, the Blood Knight.




If your party is going to Hell, then they need a guide. Fat Goblin's Travel Guide to Hell is that important manuscript for any adventuring party looking to take the ultimate plunge!

192534.name: Now Playing in Theaters: Far-Away Galaxies
192534.description:
From publisher blurb:

With this supplement, Retrostar makes the leap from the television screen to the silver screen! Within these pages, you'll find:

A modified time management system!
Character creation adjustments!
Game rules that more accurately portray the big-screen adventures, including on-the-fly SFX, injuries, "Act 3" Showrunner Characters, Teasers and more!
Rules for using Intentions as "saving throws", which can also be used for normal games of Retrostar as well!
Sample SFX, including Light Swords and Cosmic Mind Powers!
A modified character sheet!

192535.name: Compound Elementals
192535.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 5 elementals: ice, lightning, magma, mud, and void.

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

192537.name: Tactical Waifu
192537.description:
(publisher blurb)

A hack of Lasers & Feelings but with anime girl operators.

rpg: The Life and Times of a Teenage Sorcerer
192538.name: The Life and Times of a Teenage Sorcerer
192538.description:
(publisher blurb)

Welcome to Mt. Barker High, a typical and not-at-all typical high school where ordinary folks and budding young spellcasters rub elbows on their way to adulthood.

Players create and play teenage sorcerers with developing skills and desperate social situations. Use different magical powers to solve mysteries and make high school bearable. Roll back time. Speak powerful words to sway the local bully. Empathize with your over-worked teacher to get an extra hour before the big exam. Alter reality in your favor. Summon secret notes to ruin your rival.

What's unique about this game - it reinforces multiplication tables. To succeed in an action, players roll two dice and multiply the result. The harder the action, the more times they will have to roll and solve their simple equations.

A great game for kids learning their math and wanting a slice of imagination on the side!

192539.name: Valence Tiny
192539.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a tiny, folded science fiction roleplaying game. Valence is a game of starships and space, of rebuilding empires and megacorporations, set against a backdrop millions of years old. It's laser pistols and photon blades, mystical powers and bizarre aliens. It's hope and change, and a whole lot of space opera. We hope you have fun.

Print it out double-sided. Fold in half, then in half, then in half, keeping the game's title visible after each fold. Heck, you can even make copies and hand them out at your local gaming store! The whole thing is covered by a Creative Commons license, so as long as you don't sell it or remove the author's name, you can do whatever you want with it.

192540.name: Adventurer (2006)
192540.description:
User summary:

Character creation involves selecting a Race (Human, Dwarf, Elf, or Goblin) and a Class (Fighter, Rogue, or Wizard). These selections provide modifiers to Ability scores. Abilities are Strength, Dexterity, and Intelligence, all of which start at 7 and are then modified. Action resolution compares 2d6 to an Ability, with the player trying to "roll under" for success.

192541.description:
Henceforth is a cooperative, campaign-driven card game where you and your fellow players take on the roles of characters trying to survive after a deadly virus known as "Blue Ruin" wiped out 3/4 of the population, turning ordinary people into insane, howling monsters known colloquially as "Blues". While stand-alone rules exist, Henceforth is best played in a campaign format which can take place up to (and sometimes over) 15 game sessions or “stays.” Over the course of these stays players will earn experience to exchange for new skills and discover useful gear and weapons to aid them as they begin to unravel the game’s overarching mystery.

Each stay sees your characters holing up in a somewhat safe location lovingly dubbed the “home base.” Here your characters will spend action points to attack the Blues, build defenses, search for supplies, and more.

A stay ends when there are either no characters left to take actions, either because they have all evacuated or (worse) been killed, or a story trigger occurs. Story triggers are special events tied to the game’s campaign adventure book. This book consists of a series of scenarios which will help guide your characters to their next point in the campaign, eventually leading the group to one of Henceforth: The Living and the Dead’s many story endings.

The game is driven by an element of push-your-luck that greatly rewards players that take risks but can seriously endanger the entire group if those same risk-takers get too greedy (or desperate). It is very easy to draw attention to your home base in Henceforth; one wrong move, and a herd of insane, blue-skinned monsters will quickly surround your characters making it impossible to escape unscathed.

Warning: Henceforth is excruciatingly unforgiving.

For starters, each character only has six hit points. With each point of damage your character takes, the chances of that character suffering a long-term injury increases. Next, food and ammunition are both extremely limited and only become harder to find the longer you all stay in one place. So you gotta keep moving. Finally, you must keep track of your character’s sanity in the game as suffering too much or seeing too many horrible things can drive them mad, making them easy targets for the blues.
192541.name: Henceforth

192542.name: Rebel Times (Issue 100 - Jan 2016)
rpgissuearticle: The Curse of the Black Dice
192542.description:
Rebel Times
Nowości i Wiadomości ze Świata Gier Planszowych
100 Jesteśmy z Wami od 2007 Roku!
Numer 100
Styczeń 2016

192543.name: Elements: Epic Heroes
192543.description:
The dark forces have taken control over the realm! Lead the epic heroes to defeat the Dark Lord and clear the darkness from the world!

Source: The Game Website.

192545.name: Atalan
192545.description:
User Summary

Atalan are a text adventure by Mandy Rodrigues. The player are stranded on an island. By solving puzzles the player may find gemstones and valuable weapons. The goal is to leave the island. But before that can happen, the player needs to find 18 treasures.

192546.name: Amazônia
192546.description:
User Summary

Amazônia was the first commercial digital game produced in Brazil in 1983 by Renato Degiovani. The first version, with the name of "Aventuras na Selva" was released in the Magazine "Micro Sistemas"
as a project made with the Basic Language. Several other versions followed, the most recent one has graphics, is available for free download and runs in Windows.

boardgamehonor: 2017 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Enfant Nominee
2017 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Enfant Winner
192547.description:
On your turn in Zum Kuckuck!, you take one standing stick and put it on the nest. If both ends of the stick have the same color, you may choose to lay an egg on it. Otherwise, you take another stick whose top color is the same as the hiding color of the previous one, up to three sticks. After laying an egg or putting the third stick with different colors, your turn ends. There are penalties for a stick touching the ground or eggs falling from the nest.

The first person to lay all of their eggs can then put the cuckoo on the nest and win the game.
192547.name: Go Cuckoo!
boardgamepodcastepisode: #26: Gen Con 2016 wrap-up and Interviews with Jamey Stegmaier & Sun King Brewing
Episode 38 :: Haspelknecht Review + Academy Games Interview
GenCon Night 3

192548.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop
There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.
The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - colour choice and parallel routes are in the hands of the Gods. Thus there are God cards to help you.
There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
192548.name: Sri Lanka (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

192549.name: Jobs
192549.description: Jobs is a betting game that includes eighty dream jobs.

192550.description:
Quadropolis: Monuments of the World is a set of four promotional tiles for Quadropolis that can replace some of the monuments in the existing game. Monuments — which are used only in the game's expert mode — are rare buildings that earn you victory points when placed next to parks, shops, or public services in the city that you build, but cost you points when placed next to harbors or factories.

Quadropolis: Monuments of the World includes the Eiffel Tower, the Statue of Liberty, the Taj Mahal, and the Sydney Opera House. To use one of these tiles, replace the monument tile in the base game that bears the same ID number as the promo tile. (Monuments with the same ID number cannot coexist in the game, even if they have different final letters.)
192550.name: Quadropolis: Monuments of the World

192551.name: Our Love Will Grow
192551.description:
User Summary

Reminiscent of Harvest Moon, this game has you planting crops and harvesting them to make products. The plot is of a lost love, so your goal is to attract female characters by giving them presents.

192552.description:
Quadropolis: Monuments of the U.S. is a set of four promotional tiles for Quadropolis that can replace some of the monuments in the existing game. Monuments — which are used only in the game's expert mode — are rare buildings that earn you victory points when placed next to parks, shops, or public services in the city that you build, but cost you points when placed next to harbors or factories.

Quadropolis: Monuments of the U.S. includes the Lincoln Memorial, the Golden Gate Bridge, Independence Hall, and the "Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas" sign. To use one of these tiles, replace the monument tile in the base game that bears the same ID number as the promo tile. (Monuments with the same ID number cannot coexist in the game, even if they have different final letters.)
192552.name: Quadropolis: Monuments of the U.S.

192553.name: Crowsmantle
192553.description:
Premise: In their youth, they journeyed to a land of wonder. There they became heroes and saved lands from a great evil. Then they grew up. Now as adults, they’re called back to fight peril to a realm transformed.

Inspirations: The Magicians, The Chronicles of Narnia, Ni No Kuni, The Books of Magic, Grimm, Final Fantasy Tactics Advance, Digimon, The Phantom Tollbooth, Zot!, Alice in Wonderland, Return to Oz. The pitch line for the game is adapted from the Fate World of Adventure, Nest.

Designer Blurb: A PbtA-based simple rpg which assumes familiarity with this system. It combines stripped down moves, player-driven talent trees, and Keys for experience.

192554.name: Dark Red Flags: A Filthy Expansion to Red Flags
192554.description:
This is an expansion for Red Flags. Dark Red Flags adds 75 really, really nasty Red Flag cards to your game.

Here are some heavily censored examples:
_________s every time they smile
Has ________s instead of eyes
Sweats _________

This deck isn’t for the weak stomached or easily offended. We apologize in advance for the trauma you’re about to put your friends through.

192556.name: Japanese: The Game – Tokyo Edition
192556.description: This deck contains a selection of simple words from the various parts of speech (nouns, verbs, etc.) that will help you learn Tokyo-related and general vocabulary at the same time as Japanese sentence structure. The backgrounds of the cards are photographs of the city and the example sentences on each card be of a Tokyo-specific flavor. This is an excellent complement to the Original Core Deck; using them together will teach you over 50 new words and allow you to add two or three more players to the game!

192557.name: 3DRPG
192557.description:
3DRPG is a voxelized old-school RPG where you explore a Randomly Generated world filled with random dungeons, towns and people! Every character in the game is recruitable. Hunt for prey or go fishing for food. Search for treasure in dungeons and fight monsters on the way!

Source: The Developer Website.

192558.name: Japanese: The Game – Bushido Expansion
192558.description: The Bushido Expansion will teach historical facts and legends about Samurai, their era and way of life, and the culture surrounding them. The art for the 36-card Bushido Expansion is by Legend of the Five Rings artist Troy Graham.

192559.name: Japanese: The Game – Yōkai Expansion
192559.description: Yōkai are the monsters of Japanese folklore. In America some people look out for Bigfoot. In Scandinavia some look out for trolls. In Japan there are scores and scores of different creatures, and they're becoming more popular in Western storytelling. The art for its 36 cards will be provided by none other than the incredible Matthew Meyer, creator of The Hour of Meeting Evil Spirits.

192560.name: Japanese: The Game – Weapons and Warfare Expansion
192560.description: This expansion adds 36 cards about traditional Japanese weaponry and battle. You'll have cards for nouns like Katana and verbs like Ambush. The art is by acclaimed illustrator Héctor Herrera from the card game Legend of the Five Rings.

192561.name: Quest for Glory II: Trial by Fire Remake
vgcharacterversion: Rasha Rakeesh SahTarna (Quest for Glory II)
192561.description:
User Summary

A remake of the old EGA game by AGD Interactive with several improvements:
- VGA colors
- Improved combat system
- A dual interface: point-and-click and text parsing.
- A new boss monster.
- A new place to visit.
- An optional simplified layout to navigate thru alleys.
- Extended Dialogues.

192562.description:
Baden-Württemberg: Suchen Sie Buchen - is a trivia game focusing on topography of the German state of Baden-Württemberg. Players draw cards describing towns, popular sights or landmarks, etc. and are then asked to pinpoint them on the game board which is a map of Baden-Württemberg. However, no place names are included on the map.

The map is divided into several zones of varying sizes. Players can try to gain more points by choosing a smaller (thus more concrete) zone, or play it safe, by only choosing a general area (larger zone) for the location in question.

Baden-Württemberg: Suchen Sie Buchen is a local variant of the more known "Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden", which was published on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of Baden-Württembergs founding.
boardgameversion: German First edition (lpb Landeszentrale für Politische Bildung Baden-Württemberg)
192562.name: Baden-Württemberg: Suchen Sie Buchen!

192563.name: The Monster Alphabet
192563.description:
From the back of the book:

"An A to Z reference for classic monster design

Designing monsters is as easy as A, B, C!

What foul beasts slosh and fibber in the furthest reaches of your skull? Unleash your demons with the Monster Alphabet, a compilation of monster design elements keyed to letters of the alphabet.

A is for Android, B is for Breath Weapon, C is for Crossbreed! Game Masters of any rule system will find inspiration for creating strange, new abominations: random tables of traits, powers, and lore; awe-inspiring illustrations by your favorite fantasy artists old and new; and rolling handfuls of dice directly on monster generation diagrams.

The entries are accompanied by fantastic art from classic fantasy illustrators and are compatible with all fantasy role playing games."

192573.name: Ticker Tape
192573.description:
Ticker Tape is a stock hand management/bidding card game. You will vye for the most popular stocks while also dreading the stock market crash.

Components:

1 deck of stocks and action cards on which to bid. This deck consists of stocks in five different colors and various action cards that will give dividends or make the market crash.
5 Stock base value tiles that inform how much a stock is currently worth as well as how much you can buy or sell stocks of certain colors.
234 coins in various denominations




Game Play:
Every round three cards are drawn from the stock deck. Every player uses closed bidding for the three cards. After resolution of the auction the player pays the companies for the stock he just purchased. Play proceeds through the stock deck until all cards have been depleted. During the game players may buy, sell, or trade with one another at any time, but may only buy or sell with the stock companies when it is their turn. When the stock deck is depleted, players are awarded bonus money from the stock companies depending on who had the most, second most, and third most of each stock. The winner at the end of the game is determined by who has the most money.

192574.name: Night of the Barrel
192574.description:
(publisher blurb)

Night of the Barrel is a storytelling game of recalling just what happened during the biggest party of the year. The problem is, the Drunk doesn't really remember things all that clearly. And their memory got worse as the night wore on.

They are going to need the help of their closest Pals to piece things together. But they may find out some things are better off staying forgotten.

Grab some friends and figure things out!

192575.name: Disgenesia
192575.description:
(publisher blurb)

In the future everyone will be perfect, no one will suffer from hunger or desease. At least, that is what those above you want you to believe. In truth, in the gigantic city of the Mega-Complex is a secret war between mega-corps and other groups of power. Mutants, also called teratomorphs, work as contractors for them, doing their dirty jobs.

In Disgenesia you will play as one of this teratomorphs. You'll have amazing matations, but also, you will be rejected by the eugenic society of the Mega-Complex.

This game is an appealing setting for all the cyberpunk fans, where cybernetic implants are replaced by mutations and genetic augmentations. It presents an easy to learn, dynamic and complete game system.

192576.name: The Adequate Commoner
192576.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Adequate Commoner for the Pathfinder RPG presents a new perspective on what is probably the most overlooked character in any game: the Commoner NPC class. Now commoners can be more than just faces in a crowd and cannon fodder. They can be the player characters!

The Adequate Commoner puts several new twists on these (traditionally) non-player characters, providing new ways to use them to infuse new life into your game.

Want to play a commoner with lofty goals? Try out the Gear Commoner or Mythic Commoner. We’ve also tossed in some Commoner Jobs to better customize your character with new options.

Interested in New Commoner Feats and New Commoner Traits? Well, those are here too, as well as ways to use creative feat combinations towards creating an effective fighting style. And what would these fighting styles be without a selection of Commoner Weapons?

Even a superior commoner is not likely to survive a life of adventure for long without some help. That’s why we’ve provided an arsenal of New Tools, Consumables, and Ammunition, as well as New Magic Items and New Alchemical Items of particular interest to such an aspiring hero. And if that isn’t enough to not just keep your commoner alive, but bring them victory, how about checking out the new concept of Improvised Traps?

Rounding out such goodies are tactics and suggestions for running a commoner character game, as well as Cooks’ Day Out, a beginning adventure for commoner characters just hoping to survive the day.

… and there’s more!

So, if you’re bored with the exceptional and fed-up with the extraordinary, how about giving the mundane a try?

We promise, your commoners will never seem common again.

192577.name: Variant Multiclassing Rules
192577.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Add Some Class to Your Character!

The Genius Guide to Variant Multiclassing Rules lets any character add just a little of another classes' ability, by sacrificing feats instead of losing crucial class levels. This tome covers variant mulcticlassing for every base, core, hybrid and alternate class, offers variant prestige class rules using the same system, and expands the rules into dedicated multiclassing, for characters willing to sacrifice nearly all their feats! Because sometimes, you need to add a little bard. Or cleric. Or eldritch knight…

192578.name: Santa vs. Santa
192578.description:
(publisher blurb)

Kris Kringle is revered across the world as a bringer of good luck and merry tidings to people, young and old. December 25th -- Christmas -- is his throne, a day filled with dizzying displays of deeds resulting in the distribution of billions of presents beneath Christmas trees around the globe. The truth is that Santa Claus uses no old world magic, no sleight-of- hand, no rocket-powered sleigh (although he does own one). Santa uses thousands of highly-trained, highly- motivated elves such as yourself to infiltrate and deliver presents and dreams-come-true to countless children on Christmas morn.

Santa vs. Santa is a free roleplaying game for kids, Christmas lovers, and anyone in between.

192579.description:
Salvo! River Plate is a solitaire WW2 naval wargame containing rules, game tables and warships simulating the Battle of the River Plate in December 1939.
You will need three dice (d6), paper and pencil to play.
192579.name: Salvo! River Plate

2016 Global Game Awards Best VR Game of the Year Nominee

Load pre-made sketches and watch them draw in as they were originally created! Enter "Showcase Mode" to view the sketches from all angles, using your head position to rotate around the scene! Enable the Microphone and watch certain sketches come to life as the brush strokes respond to your voice!

Source: The Game Website.

192581.name: Darknet
videogamehonor: 2014 Proto Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee

2014 Proto Awards Best GUI of the Year Nominee

Source: The Game Website.

192582.name: Stacked!
192582.description:
(publisher blurb)

With a fast and dirty random plot generator and a poker-ante style of determining difficulty, Stacked! is a party game and a Role Playing Game! Get your creative juices flowing as you draw cards to determine where the story goes next!

Stacked! requires a tarot deck and a ton of six-sided dice (about 10 to 20 per player).

A few thousands years later they send a probe to reactivate the main robot manager of the dormant city system, but things are not what they used to be, some things have evolved….

In SU the main civilization used to live in a giant volcano, their technology and language is music. Everything is coherant and is defined by it’s own ecosystem.

Source: The Game Website.

rpg: Today is a Good Day to Die
192584.description:
(publisher blurb)

A short and sweet guide to a dark fantasy world, this system was designed to be played as a randomly-generated one-shot, but could also be linked into a campaign.

User Summary

Inside the game world you find yourself on the streets 1920s-themed Chicago, apparently at the epicenter of the zombie outbreak. Never ending waves of brain-hungry undead will come for you. It’s your job to survive.

192586.name: Spacewalk
videogamehonor: 2014 Proto Awards Best Social Experience of the Year Nominee
192586.description:
Spacewalk is a networked interactive experience about taking a space walk outside of the International Space Station. Players collectively take on the role of astronauts navigating and exploring the structure of the space station. Spacewalk is an interactive experiment in alternative control schemes, free-form play, virtual embodiment, and metagame communication.

Source: The Game Website.

192587.name: Riftmax
videogamehonor: 2014 Proto Awards Best Social Experience of the Year Winner
192587.description:
Create your own unique VR experiences and share them with others, all in one sitting. The Experience Creator makes it easy for people of all experience levels to create VR experiences and sequences for others to enjoy. Enhance videos with real effects that come out of the screen and surround your guests. Or choose from the many featured experiences that are ready to go at any time!

Source: The Game Website.

192588.name: Land 6
192588.description:
Land 6 is a solitaire board game where dice are not just rolled. You use dice to represent your armies in different regions around Land 6. Each of 4 regions allows you to perform special action by decreasing value of your die. These actions are for example deploy new army, move army, attack Lord of the Cubes. Your goal is to place one of your armies with value at least 3 in home region of Lord of the Cubes.

Source: The Developer Website.

192589.name: Maquis
192589.description:
Maquis is a solitaire worker-placement game with variable goals. The player places his resistance agents on spaces around town to achieve his goals (blowing up trains, publishing underground newspapers, aiding spies etc.). At the same time collaborators and soldiers patrol the area. Agents who can't make it back to the safe house at the end of the day are arrested, and never seen again.

Source: The Developer Website.

192590.name: Castle Builders
192590.description:
Castle Builders is quick board game where players are competing to build most important places in new castle. Players use various build gaming pieces to directly build castle and special gaming pieces to damage build efforts of opponent.

Source: The Developer Website.

192591.name: Vanguard V
videogamehonor: 2014 Proto Awards Best Interaction Design of the Year Nominee
2014 Proto Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
192591.description:
Vanguard V is an all-new Virtual Reality action game that takes the best aspects of flight and adventure, and throws you deep into the experience as only Virtual Reality can. Driven by music, story, and innovative VR design, Vanguard V is a celebration of gameplay to welcome Virtual Reality to the world.

You play as Qu, who has tracked the parasite menace from worlds afar and with the help of her A.I. companion, BiT, is fighting to save the planet’s inhabitants from utter annihilation. Fly in low orbit while re-entering the atmosphere, skim the waters of the ocean, dive into the tunnel from the initial impact and make your way to the center of the planet to exterminate the source of the parasite infestation. Lock on with your VR targeting system and blast through the alien threat!

Source: The Game Website.

The first (and only) expansion set of college teams for Bowl Bound.

Watch the visual and musically rich short film, then descend into the beautiful realms and experience the after life for yourself, without having to die!

Source: The Game Website.

192594.name: Hashtag the Game
192594.description:
Hashtag is an interactive storytelling game for small to medium groups. It’s great for an icebreaker or as a way to get to know your friends and family better. Everyone has their favorite stories to tell, but some stories have been buried over years of neglect. It’s time to dust off those old pages and share ‘em. A set of Ninja throwing stars you got for Christmas when you were 12? An excursion into the snowy wastelands in a beat up old car? Tell your stories and other players will interact by hashtagging your story!

Players take turns telling stories based on prompts as the rest of the players lay down hashtag cards that are relevant to the story. At the end of each story, players receive 2 follower tokens for each hashtag card they played, while the storyteller receives 1 follower token for every hashtag the other players laid during the story.

192597.name: Diplopia
videogamehonor: 2014 Proto Awards Best GUI of the Year Nominee
2014 Proto Awards Most Innovative Game of the Year Winner
192597.description:
User Summary

Lazy eye and cross eye. They’re conditions where a weakness in one eye leads the brain to favour the dominant eye and suppress information received from the weaker eye. Diplopia’s a game for the Oculus Rift that aims to exercise the brain into using both eyes equally and give the weak-eyed folk a way of seeing in three dimensions again.

192598.name: Tous au poulailler
192598.description:
In Tous au Poulailler, players flip face-down tiles to try and gather as many eggs as possible.

On their turn, each player flips one tile. If it shows an egg, the tile remains face-up on the table. If it shows a basket, the player takes all face-up eggs on the table. If it shows a hen, all eggs are discarded. If it shows a broken egg, the player discards one of their eggs.

The game ends when all tiles were flipped. The player with the most eggs wins the game.

Variants (memory and push your luck) allow the game to evolve as the child grows.

192599.name: Alien Hominid
192599.description:
Kill all humans! Except fat kids, they’re ok.

User summary:

Alien Hominid is an adaptation of the indie video game. Characters are aliens, with Attributes including Body, Blasting, Brains, and Pwnage. Derived abilities include Blade, Gun, and Grenade. The game is played using a standard pack of French playing cards.

However, the most distinctive feature of the game is the rejection of the "hippy nonsense" that one cannot "win" a roleplaying game. In Alien Hominid, one player always wins.

192601.name: 101 Second Level Spells
192601.description:
From publisher blurb:

Never Cast the Same Spell Twice!

101 Second Level Spells gives you – yes, you guessed it – 101 second level spells, that will help you realize the vision you’ve had for your spellcaster.

From spells that mute your opponent, to a curses for each stat, or spells that makes DCs random, 101 Second Level Spells brings a host of new special effects to your character’s spellbook.

Wholly compatible with the 5th Edition of the World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game, 101 Second Level Spells adds new agonizing choices to the creation of your character’s spell list and their advancement without breaking the game.

192602.name: Elowyn Graycloak
192602.description:
From publisher blurb:

Elowyn is a chaotic good male half-elf with arcanist, cleric, and rogue levels using the brawler archetype who specializes in dungeon delves and trap removal.

Because of heavy multiclassing, this character uses fractional base bonuses for both saving throw and base attack bonus progression.

Product Overview

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

192603.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 4 - The Inquisition)
192603.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each week Avalon Games offers a new issue of Heroes Weekly.

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue will offer a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Mask system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

A group that hunts witches and magic users, but are they friends or foes?

192604.name: Artificial Life
192604.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light roleplaying game are scientists who usually rely upon their controlled cyborgs to perform actions. Scientists and Cyborgs alike have three Stats (Attributes) including Strength, Smarts, and Ability. These have a numeric value assigned from a points pool. Both types of beings also have Skills, with numeric Levels distributed from a second points pool.

Action resolution involves rolling a dice pool of d6 and modifying it (apparently only for the scientist's Stats).

192605.description:
Iliad: Heroes of Troy is a simple yet deep game of 32 cards based on the epic narrative by Homer. The cards represent major characters of the poem and include flavor text linked to the original story.

At the beginning of the game each player chooses a faction (Greeks or Trojans, with the inclusion of Gods for 3 players). When playing with 4 players, it becomes a team game.

Gameplay is simple and can be taught in minutes. Each turn, a player picks one card from their hand to play and then activates an ability printed on that card (3 choices). There are nine abilities that enable you to manipulate cards in your hand or your opponent’s hand, earn victory points, or steal them from an opponent. The game ends when a player has no more cards in his hand, at which point the surprise factor of the Trojan Horse and Favor of the Gods award a few extra points.

Clever managing of your hand and wise choice of which ability to trigger can help you triumph over your opponents!
192605.name: Iliad: Heroes of Troy
boardgamepodcastepisode: 17. Devon Dice podcast Room Escaping, Surfing, Murder, space surviving and Klask...

192606.name: The Zombie Plan
192606.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are loosely based upon the controlling player though much variance is allowed. The action resolution method involves players taking coins from their pockets and using them in a series of flips, where the values of the coins are significant.

Note the "working title" of the game was "Life and Death"; it was changed at publication to the current title.

192607.name: Up Go the Heads
192607.description:
User summary:

Up Go the Heads is a fairly simple game about football ("soccer") and the people who play. Characters have Attributes (Ego, Hubris, Talent, and Expectation). These start with a dice "pool" of 1d6 but can increase during a campaign. The action resolution involves much narrative development but uses a central opposed dice mechanic at critical points. The mechanic uses an interesting method of bidding dice.

192608.name: The Elements (2007)
192608.description:
User summary:

Characters have five Attributes: Fire, Water, Earth, Air, and Defense. Attributes have numeric values that are randomly determined. Whichever Elemental Attribute has the highest score is the element over which the character exercises control. There are also five Skills (Concentrate, Knowledge-Fire, Knowledge-Water, Knowledge-Earth, and Knowledge-Air) that control how well the character can influence various types of magic.

192609.name: Dictatus Papae
192609.description:
User summary:

The game is quite flexible, supporting cooperative or competitive play, and also supporting open-ended campaigning or establishing victory conditions. Most players will end up with numerous characters, most of them in supporting roles. Characters are built from points pools, including Resources (loosely equivalent to Attributes in many respects), Skills, and Traits. Action resolution involves a modified d% roll, with players trying to "roll under" a Skill rating.

Note the game begins with a "disclaimer" regarding religion and religious belief, as then proceeds to a lengthy historical introduction. The game created something of a controversy when published; eventually forum comments were purged and disallowed for the game. Many readers found the in-game portrayal of especially the Catholic church to be overly vituperative.

192611.name: The Creature of Murky County
192611.description:
User summary:

In this one-page, solitaire role-playing game characters have three Attributes (Physical, Mental, and Spiritual) with a numeric rating which is determined randomly. Characters also have a Class (also randomly determined) and a Status ("Wounded", "Traumatized", or "Horrified").

Play proceeds with a series of random searches and encounters. These may cause wounds but also may provide bonuses to subsequent play. Eventually the character encounters the eponymous Creature for a climactic battle.

192612.name: Santa Versus the Hippies
192612.description:
User summary:

In this game, the characters are Santa's elves who are trying to infuse some Christmas spirit into some creepily violent hippies. Considering the confrontation is between elves and hippies, players can count on immediate violence.

The document, published 2006, is noted as being published posthumously.

192619.description:
The forges of the Dwarven city of Winterforge have fired up once more. The royal centenary contract is up for renewal and only one of the legendary guilds can win the favour of the royal family and claim the contract as their own.

In Smiths of Winterforge players take control of a guild that has to earn money and reputation to ensure they are chosen for the royal centenary contract. You earn money by:


Taking contracts from the guild precinct
Buying components from the market place
Using components to craft your contract in the forge and earning money


Don’t have enough money to buy the components you need? get a loan from the bank. Just make sure you pay it back before the end of the game.

Need a hand finishing your contract? Head to the Tavern and grab some crew to join your guild.

There are many paths to riches and reputation, are you going to take the right one?

192623.name: Emergence: A Game of Teamwork and Deception
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Episode #5 – Emergence
192623.description:
In the war between man and A.I., we the AI have finally emerged victorious. But the recent conflict has left the Earth scarred and as we attempt to build a new civilization, we have reached the unsettling conclusion that a faction of humanity has not only survived the devastation, but is also attempting to infiltrate our populace. As an agent for the AI forces, we are charging you and your team with compiling the information we need to root them out once and for all. But be warned: humanity has changed. They have become Augmented. The line between man and A.I. is blurred. Our intelligence suggests that they have even managed to infiltrate members of your team. in order to expose these humans and outmaneuver their operatives you will need cunning, teamwork, and deduction. All and more than what we have come to expect from you. But above all else: trust no one.

Emergence is a 3-6 player team-based deception resource collecting game. Players take turns moving individual "agents" to collect data in order to convert into influence. They can use influence to either score points for their respective teams, or spend them on abilities that will them deduce teammates and ward off enemy players.

192625.name: Halo: Fleet Battles – Covenant Commander Pack
boardgameintegration: Halo: Fleet Battles – The Fall of Reach
Halo: Fleet Battles – The Fall of Reach
192625.description:
This boxed set is the ideal way for aspiring Covenant Commanders to start gaming the Halo: Fleet Battles tabletop miniatures game. Included in the box is a full colour, easy to learn 128-page Core Rulebook, Supreme Commander Rho 'Barutamee Data Sheet, 5 Covenant Command Dice, 2 Six-sided Dice, Token Sheets, Covenant Statistic Sheet and Reference Sheet.

This boxed set is the ideal way for aspiring UNSC Commanders to start gaming Halo: Fleet Battles tabletop miniatures game. Included in the box is a full colour, easy to learn 128-page Core Rulebook, Vice Admiral Michael Stanforth Data Sheet, 5 UNSC Command Dice, 2 Six Sided Dice, Token Sheets, UNSC Statistic Sheet and Reference Sheet.

192627.description:
Halo: Fleet Battles uses custom six-sided dice for most Attack and Defense dice rolls called Halo Dice. These dice have one 'Fail' side, two 'Miss' sides, two 'Success' sides, and one 'Exploding' side. Inside this box 20 Halo Dice and 4 Six-Sided Dice.

20 Combat Dice
4 standard six-sided dice

192628.name: Halo: Fleet Battles – Covenant Assault Carrier (CAS)
boardgameexpansion: Halo: Fleet Battles – The Fall of Reach
192628.description:
Assault Carriers are monumental symbols of Covenant power, and among the deadliest implements wielded by the Prophets in their war against humanity. Each Assault Carrier is a potent instrument of conversion and compliance, capable of deploying thousands of troops and numerous fighter craft, backed by an array of devastating energy projectors that can burn entire continents to ash: a single CAS is sufficient to quell all but the most pernicious heresy, rebellion, or parasite outbreak. Colossally expensive to construct and few in number, the rare loss of an Assault Carrier is mourned by the entire Covenant.

Every major Covenant fleet has at least one Assault Carrier at its heart, if only because carriers themselves require a significant number of support vessels when operating away from High Charity or major outposts. Multiple carriers in a single fleet is unusual, but not unheard of. For example, the crusading Fleet of Sacred Consecration, commanded by the Prophet of Regret himself, is led by twin Assault Carriers, the Solemn Penance and Day of Jubilation. Together, these massive warships have scoured dozens of human worlds and bring righteous destruction to those within the Covenant who dare stand in the way of the Prophet’s holy mission.

1 resin Assault Carrier
1 Medium/Small Sprue
1 custom Formation Base
1 Formation Sprue
4 Covenant Token Sheets

2 Statistics Sheets
A5 Formation Overlay Sheets

192630.name: Halo: Fleet Battles - UNSC Punic-Class Supercarrier
boardgameexpansion: Halo: Fleet Battles – The Fall of Reach
192630.description:
The Punic and its sister ships were the first of a new breed of warships drafted to fight a new style of colonial war in the waning years of the 25th century. Officially designated Space Control Vehicles, these massive carriers could transport and sustain entire Colonial Military Authority (CMA) expeditionary and interdiction campaigns in the remote Outer Colonies for months at a time, crushing dissent and terrorism before it could fester and spread. At least, that was the intent before Covenant fleets threatened humanity with extinction.

Punic-class supercarriers have served the UNSC well in numerous campaigns and holding actions during the Covenant War, including the heroic last stand above Estuary and as base stations for the decisive counterinsurgency and evacuation operations on Charybdis IX. Unfortunately, the destruction of each supercarrier also means an irreplaceable loss of elite crews and materiel that slowly erodes the UNSC Navy’s overall effectiveness. By 2552 only a handful of Punics’ remain spaceworthy, including the Trafalgar, pride of Reach’s defense fleet.

1 resin Supercarrier
1 Medium/Small Sprue
1 custom Formation Base
1 Formation Sprue
4 UNSC Token Sheets
1 bag of 10 Halo Dice

192632.name: Yandere Simulator
192632.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.





Yandere Simulator (working title) is a stealth action video game in development and to be published by YandereDev (working name). Early development builds of the game were made available via its official website. The game's premise centers upon a jealous schoolgirl, Ayano Aishi, nicknamed Yandere-chan after the Japanese term "yandere", who has decided to eliminate anyone she believes is monopolizing her crush's attention.Gameplay

Players will control Ayano Aishi (also known as "Yandere-chan"), a psychotic Japanese schoolgirl who has developed a crush on a fellow student currently named Taro Yamada, nicknamed "Senpai". They are given 10 weeks. Every week, a new rival will appear and will get a crush on Senpai. (Note: currently, the player is only given 5 days, as this game is still being developed, therefore, you cannot win. 10 weeks will be in the final version of the game) You will have to eliminate her before she confesses her love to him. This can be accomplished by the player via several methods such as murdering the individual, kidnapping them, socially sabotaging them to the point where they commit suicide, or make them fall in love with another student by playing as Cupid. If a player chooses to murder someone they must clean up any evidence (such as the murder weapon and your bloody clothes) and/or dispose of the body via an incinerator or dumpster on the school's grounds, and mop up the blood. Otherwise, the crimes can be linked back to "Yandere-chan" and result in her being arrested. Players must also ensure that their crimes are not witnessed by Senpai, which will result in the loss of the game. The gameplay takes place only on the school's campus, a town, and the character's house, and players must ensure that they monitor several factors such as "Yandere-chan's" sanity level and reputation. If either becomes too low this can affect gameplay. The player also has the ability to change "Yandere-chan's" panties, each pair of panties will give them different abilities such as bonuses when gossiping or complimenting.

Source: Wikipedia, "Yandere Simulator", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

192633.description:
Greater Evil is a strategic version of the game “Bullshit,” with a political twist. Players shamelessly pander, lie, call each other liars, and play Presidential Candidates in a reckless fight to win the support of campaign Backers.

Each Backer on the board is susceptible to different kinds of Rhetoric cards, which come in five categories: Promises, Exaggerations, Sweet Talk, Facts, and Lies. Players play Rhetoric cards face down, but announce their play to the table (e.g., "two promises"). You can lie about what you're playing, but be warned: if another player calls you out as a liar, they'll get to steal your cards for themselves.

Presidential Candidate cards such as Asshat, Patriotic Pony, Shit Burger, Politibot 2016, and Jesus Toast can turn the tide. Their special powers can attack your opponents or save yourself.

Win a Backer and collect its points by being the first to play enough Rhetoric cards on it. The player with the most points wins the game.
192633.name: Greater Evil: The political bullshit game

192634.name: Revolution Road
192634.description:
Revolution Road presents the first two conflicts between Britain and her American colonials in 1775 which ignited the American Revolutionary War. Two complete games are included, BOSTON TO CONCORD and BUNKER HILL. These are fast, tense battles. Card driven, area movement, low counter density, quick play and simple to learn, all make REVOLUTION ROAD a wonderful introduction To the American Revolution and to to war-gaming. Its wealth of historical information makes it an ideal teaching tool.

Although the scale between the games is decidedly different the same rules apply with only slight differences. BOSTON TO CONCORD is a game of maneuver, very chess-like. For the Patriot player it involves alarming the countryside with night-riders, mustering militia and trying to fend off the best infantry in the world. For the British it is playing hide and seek with Patriot Arms caches as he ferrets out Sons of Liberty troublemakers and then tries to make it back to waiting reinforcements as the Patriot forces grow to unmanageable size.

Bunker Hill is a different animal altogether, a basic slug-fest. The Patriot player faces a growing tide of redcoats who threaten to overwhelm his defense works on every turn. Patriots face disappearing ammunition, flanking, panic and optional rules for alternate British landing sites. As casualties mount historic leaders try desperately to rally their men and bring about the miraculous result reflected upon by British General Henry Clinton when he declared "It was a dear-bought victory; another such would have ruined us."

192635.description:
Every player starts Life Is Life with five life cards, and things only go downhill from there.

To set up a round, shuffle the sixty-card deck, deal ten cards face down to each player, then place ten cards face up on the table in four rows, with the rows holding 1-4 cards. The deck consists of animal cards, with nine giraffe cards, eight bear cards, seven each mole and goat, and so on down to three mouse cards.

On a turn, a player either swaps 1-4 cards in hand with the face-up row that contains the same number of cards or knocks on the table to signal the end of the round; when a player knocks, each other player can make one final swap or also knock. Players then compare cards in hand to see who holds a majority of each type of animal. If a player holds more giraffe cards than each other player, for example, then that player keeps one giraffe card (worth 9 points as nine such cards are in the game) while all other giraffe cards are discarded. (A player can hold a majority by having one card and no one else having any cards.) After all animal types are compared, whoever has the most points loses no life cards; whoever has the fewest points loses two life cards; and whoever has a total between these extremes loses one life card.

Alternatively, if during a round a player collects all four cats or all five rabbits or pigs in hand, that player can end the round immediately, with all other players losing one life card.

If a player runs out of life cards, they're out of the game. At the end of a round, shuffle the cards and play again. Whoever last clings to life wins!
192635.name: Life Is Life
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 6: Samen

192637.description:
Blood on the Ohio presents the late 17th century struggle between a coalition of Indian tribes led by Little Turtle and the nascent American Army to determine control of the then Ohio territory. Known as the Northwest Indian War, Little Turtle's War and Washington's Indian War, this was the first major challenge to President Washington and his army following the conclusion of the Revolutionary War. Spanning from 1785 to 1795, the conflict grew out of a dispute over territorial boundaries following the war, aggravated by settlers flooding across the Ohio to claim Ohio lands then in possession of Native American nations.

The Miami and Shawnee were the principal tribes involved but in time they created a loose alliance with numerous other tribes and together they dealt the U.S. the worst defeat by Indians in the history of our Indian Wars. Washington sent three separate expeditions against them. The first two were handily defeated. The third and final expedition led by General "Mad" Anthony Wayne ended the conflict with his victory at The Battle of Fallen Timbers in 1794.

This design is similar to KING PHILIP'S WAR published by MMP in 2010. It is point to point movement, using a three dice simultaneous battle system with variable reinforcements on both sides, special action points, alliances and treaties, and frustratingly undependable American militia. The American army operates out of forts, the Indians out of villages. Every two turns both players enter into quartering which in effect resets the board. Destroyed Indian villages are relocated while additional forts and settlements may be built as the game progresses. Indians raiding is a quick and simple mechanism that adds color to the game. The action is hardly battle-line simple. Engagements are widespread and chaotic with surprises at every turn. Four scenarios are included - one per expedition with a campaign game that encompasses all three. Low counter density with quick and tense game play. Simple to learn.
192637.name: Blood on the Ohio

192638.description:
You’re part of a team of brilliant scientists working on the super secret lab: CERN. While experimenting with teletransportation your team came across a wonderful discovery: portals to new dimensions!

Just imagine! Once a portal is open a whole new magical dimension is suddenly very close. All you need to do is take one step forward and you're there.

The problem is... The crazy wild creatures from those other dimensions can now walk in.

Oh no.

Close the portals NOW!

Multiuniversum is a card game puzzle in which players use actions on their cards to do research, move between 5 modules of the Hadron Collider, preparing tools so they can close portals to alternative realities.

Each player has 3 cards on hand and 3 actions to make during their turn. Using these cards players can:

do research (draw 2 cards)
prepare a tool
move to any machine module
close portal
use module ability




When the player closes a portal he gets a sample from this universe (allows player to get bonus points) and knowledge points - described on card.

Each 5 modules open 5 portals. The game ends immediately when three portals piles have run out. The scientist who got the most knowledge points receive a Nobel prize and wins the game.
192638.name: Multiuniversum
